commentary_central: The Fed eases again as it seeks to get to neutral faster
commentary_higher: The Fed holds rates in response to persistently above target inflation data and no further bad news on the labour market
commentary_lower: The Fed votes for a jumbo cut in the face of another sharp labour market deterioration

commentary_central: The Fed takes another step towards neutral in the absence of significant changes in labour market or inflation data
commentary_higher: Rising inflation as companies pass through tariffs forces the Fed into one hold
commentary_lower: The Fed delivers at least one jumbo cut as economic activity falls sharply

commentary_central: The Fed continues to reduce rates at a quarterly pace
commentary_higher: Persistently high inflation forces the Fed to reduce rates at a slower pace
commentary_lower: Economic weakness forces the Fed to move the policy stance into accommodative territory

commentary_central: Fed continues path of easing to neutral or just below
commentary_higher: Inflationary policies require interest rates to stay higher or rise
commentary_lower: Weakness in real economy leads to faster pace of cuts or a lower estimate of neutral rates

commentary_central: The Fed gradually brings the benchmark rate back to neutral, after taking it below neutral levels in 2026
commentary_higher: The Fed is forced to remain cautious as inflation rises to well above target as a result of tariffs
commentary_lower: Political pressures or weak demand force the Fed to retain an accommodative stance

commentary_central: The Fed gradually brings the benchmark rate back to neutral, after taking it below neutral levels in 2026
commentary_higher: The Fed is forced to remain cautious as inflation rises to well above target as a result of tariffs
commentary_lower: Political pressures or weak demand force the Fed to retain an accommodative stance

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a rate similar to the long-term trend growth of the US economy plus inflation, although the path towards these rates might be bumpy with long periods outside the range.
commentary_higher: Strong growth or a growing lack of confidence in US public finances requires a higher neutral interest rate.
commentary_lower: Weak and persistently low growth generates few outside options for savings, helping the longer-term interest rate to fall to low levels.
